title: Bobcat who was injured as a kitten and lost all his survival instincts gets rescued, and his caretakers find out that his favorite toy is fennel: 'It knocked most of the... "bobcat" out of him'
description: All big cats are amazing and meowgestic, but unfortunately, not every one of them gets the same start at life. Some are a little less lucky than others, but that doesn't mean that they cannot find their joy in life. And when things like that happen - when a big cat, for whatever reason, cannot be released back into the wild, it is up to us humans to make its life as good as it can be. For some big cats, it's just about making a friend - like this shy rescued cheetah cub who got paired up with a puppy or this rescued black panther who grew up with a Rottweiler. For others, it's about finding a new purpose - like this injured bobcat who became the best foster momma to other orphaned cubs. And for T'Challa, the bobcat we're going to be talking about today, who fell on its head as a kitten after a hawk grabbed it, finding joy in life just meant discovering that fennel is the best toy ever.
author: Mariel Ruvinsky

title: A Doctor’s Order of 30 Cat Memes Fur That Mood-Boosting Effect on Your Feline-Shaped Heart
description: Unfortunately, feline fam, we woke up today feline a little under the weather. And it's not just allergies (which have also been plaguing us nonstop since Spring decided it was time to release every single pollen into the air all at once), we have a pain in our feline-shaped hearts that just won't go away. So, naturally, we went to the doctor to get it checked out. You know what they said to us? The answer to our problems is purrfectly simple - and they purrscribed us 30 cat memes to make us feel better.You see, cat memes have this meowgic about them to cure the ailments of any feline-lover with just a few simple memes. We're not one to question doctors, so we went straight to the pharmacy (I Can Has Cheezburger) and filled ourselves with hissterical feline funnies, and guess what? We're feeling better already. So even if the Meownday blues got you down, don't worry, there are always cat memes to boost your mood and make sure you're feline fine. Enjoy!
author: Blake Seidel

title: Cowardly managers ghost an employee instead of firing him, then the ex-ice rink worker gets payback by pillaging break room meals: ‘I bring a tupperware and steal as much food as I can’
description: Getting ghosted by an employer is the worst way to get 'fired,' but this ex-employee at the mall's ice rink wasn't about to let a managerial ghosting cut off his food supply. When you're fired, you have closure. Like a breakup, closure is critical to move on in your life, both emotionally and mentally. So if you're still under the impression that you're employed by a company, how are you supposed to print out your resume and campus the rest of the town for a new job? Managers utilize this tactic to keep good employees on the hook, absolving themselves of unemployment fees and saving themselves from the discomfort of actually firing someone. Alas, this college kid was too hungry to let the absence of a paycheck deter him from going to work, pillaging the break room fridge, and making management sorry they ever quiet-fired him.
author: Jesse Kessenheimer

title: 'That was blatantly a work-related activity': PT assistant bills his boss double-overtime after he instructs hourly employees to wash work towels on their own time at home, gets the policy revoked overnight
description: There are pros and cons to hourly work. While you're only getting paid while on the clock on the job, you can cash in on overtime, pickup extra shifts for more dough, and count your skrilla at the end of each pay period. And, unlike a salary position, if you get loads of new work dumped on your plate, you'll likely get paid for it. However, the employer in this next story thought he could get away with a little daylight robbery against his employees, hoping for some free, at-home labor from his workforce. Well, Buddy, this ain't a salary position! You've messed with the hourly crew this time.
author: Jesse Kessenheimer

title: The Glam Gals

title: Chekov's Dick
description: We did play some Kill Team Lite for a very particular reason which I won't spoil, but I haven't played it in a minute so I feel confident I got virtually every rule wrong. Plus, there was another issue that marred the studio session but because it is incredibly shameful I am loathe to relate it here. Not shameful for me in the least - if anything, I'm invigorated - but it is very shameful for someone else. So shameful I decided to put it on display in a public place where many, many people could see it.

title: Representative Line: The Rounding Error
description: At one point, someone noticed that some financial transactions weren't summing up correctly in the C# application Nancy supported. It didn't require Superman or a Peter Gibbons to figure out why: someone was using floating points for handling dollar amounts. That kicked off a big refactoring project to replace the usage of double types with decimal types. Everything seemed to go well, at least until there was a network hiccup and the application couldn't connect to the database. Let's see if you can figure out what happened: MessageBox.Show("Please decimal check the connection details. Also check firewall settings (port 1433) and network connectivity."); What a clbuttic mistake. [Advertisement] BuildMaster allows you to create a self-service release management platform that allows different teams to manage their applications. Explore how!
author: Remy Porter

title: Error'd: NaN is the Loneliest Number
description: Today we have a whole batch of category errors, picked out from the rash of submissions and a few that have been festering on the shelf. Just for fun, I threw in an ironic off-by-some meta-error. See if you can spot it. Adam R. "I'm looking for hotel rooms for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina. Most hotels haven't opened up reservations yet, except for ridiculously overprice hospitality packages. This search query found NaN facilities available, which equates to one very expensive apartment. I guess one is not a number now?"   Intrepid traveler BJH had a tough time at the Intercontinental. I almost feel sympathy. Almost. "I stare at nulls at home all the time so it made me feel comfortable to see them at the hotel when traveling. And what is that 'INTERCONTINENTAL W...' at the top? I may never know!"   Hoping to find out, BJ clicked through the mystery menu and discovered... this. But even worse, "There was no exit: Clicking Exit did nothing and neither did any of the buttons on the remote. Since I'd received more entertainment than usual from a hotel screen I just turned everything off."   Striking out for some streaming entertainment Dmitry NoLastName was silently stymied by this double-decker from Frontier.com.   No streaming needed for Barry M. who can get a full dose of fun from those legacy broadcast channels! Whatever did they do before null null undefined null? "Hey, want to watch TV tonight? NaN."   Hah! "That's MISTER Null, to you," declared an anonymous contributor.   And finally, another entirely different anonymous contributor clarified that there are apparently NaN cellphone towers in Switzerland. Personally, I'm intrigued by the existence of that one little crumb of English on an otherwise entirely German page.   [Advertisement] Keep all your packages and Docker containers in one place, scan for vulnerabilities, and control who can access different feeds. ProGet installs in minutes and has a powerful free version with a lot of great features that you can upgrade when ready.Learn more.
author: Lyle Seaman

title: JuJu Watkins Sprains Bun
description: LOS ANGELES—In what could prove a devastating loss for the top-seeded Big Ten team, University of Southern California star JuJu Watkins reportedly strained her bun Monday during the opening game of the NCAA Women’s March Madness tournament. “While we don’t yet know the extent of the damage, JuJu is scheduled to receive an extensive MRI […] The post JuJu Watkins Sprains Bun appeared first on The Onion.

title: The HOA really hates us, I think.
description: Just a quick note from the front-lines of our strange, ongoing battle with our Home Owner’s Association, who doesn’t think year-round 12-foot-skeletons are acceptable because skeletons are seasonal and Halloween is over. Bone Crawford remains standing. Happy early St. Patrick’s Day.
author: thebloggess
